original: Recitals.
ollama_generated:
Recitals:

Alternative Recital:

Whereas [Party A] has acknowledged that the execution and performance of its obligations under this Agreement may be contingent upon certain factors beyond its control, and [Party B], in recognizing this, wishes to mitigate any potential adverse effects on the timely completion and fulfillment of their respective obligations.

In light of the above, it is hereby agreed that:

1. Although each party shall strive diligently to meet the deadlines established within this Agreement, neither Party A nor Party B shall be deemed in breach of contract if either Party fails to meet such deadlines provided they make reasonable efforts to remedy any delays as promptly as practical under the circumstances.

2. If one party encounters unforeseen difficulties or circumstances that prevent it from fulfilling its obligations, it must notify the other party immediately and work collaboratively to find a mutually acceptable solution. This does not relieve either Party of their obligation to perform under this Agreement, but rather sets forth a process for addressing unexpected situations when they arise.

3. In the event that the parties are unable to reach an agreement on a solution, they may seek mediation or binding arbitration as provided in this Agreement's dispute resolution clause.

The original clause placed the obligation of meeting deadlines solely on both parties and potentially held them in breach for failing to meet those deadlines. The rewritten clause acknowledges that factors beyond their control may impact timely performance, allows for reasonable efforts to remedy delays, and shifts some responsibility to collaboratively finding a solution when unforeseen difficulties arise, while still maintaining the general obligation to perform under the Agreement.

original: C. Developer desires to obtain development rights for multiple restaurants under the El Pollo Loco ® System (each, an “El Pollo Loco ® Restaurant”) from Franchisor within a specified geographical (the “ Territory ”) specified in Exhibit “A”  attached hereto and made a part hereof (or if single unit, replace with “Developer desires to obtain development rights for a single restaurant under the El Pollo Loco ® System (each, an “El Pollo Loco ® Restaurant”) from Franchisor within a specified address (the “Territory”) specified in Exhibit “A”  attached hereto and made a part hereof.”) D.Franchisor is willing to grant the (non-exclusive/exclusive) right to develop and open El Pollo Loco ® Restaurant(s) within the Territory referenced in Exhibit “A.” NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and obligations herein contained, the parties hereto agree as follows:
ollama_generated:
C. The Franchisor is willing to grant (exclusive/non-exclusive) to Developer the right to develop and open El Pollo Loco ® Restaurant(s) within a geographical area specified in Exhibit "A" attached hereto and made a part hereof (or if single unit, replace with "at the address specified in Exhibit 'A' attached hereto and made a part hereof"). The Developer may request development rights for multiple restaurants under the El Pollo Loco ® System within this granted area.

   D. The Developer desires to obtain development rights for one or more El Pollo Loco ® Restaurant(s) from Franchisor, subject to Franchisor's willingness to grant such rights. In the event that the Franchisor is unwilling or unable to grant the requested development rights within the specified geographical area (as detailed in Exhibit "A"), the parties acknowledge and agree that this agreement shall not be binding on either party with regard to the requested development rights for the relevant El Pollo Loco ® Restaurant(s) in that particular area. NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and obligations herein contained, the parties hereto agree as follows:

original: 1.3.  (Only applies to multi-unit Development Agreement - delete if single-unit Development Agreement).  Prior to or concurrent with the execution of this Agreement, Developer shall meet with Franchisor’s development representatives and prepare a market development plan for the units to be constructed and opened by Developer in the Territory (identifying specific key areas, key intersections and trade areas in the Territory) and all development pursuant to this Agreement shall be in accordance with this plan (the “ Market Plan ”). The Market Plan shall include proposed areas where sites may be located, ranking and prioritization of site locations and other information customarily used by market planners in the restaurant industry. Developer and Franchisor shall jointly approve the Market Plan.
ollama_generated: 1.3. (This section applies exclusively to Multi-unit Development Agreements; disregard if a Single-unit Development Agreement is in effect.) In contrast, subsequent to or coinciding with the signing of this Agreement, Franchisee shall engage with the Franchisor's development team and compile a market development strategy for the units to be developed and operated within the Territory (specifying key locations, significant intersections, and potential trade areas within the Territory). The approach to all development under this Agreement shall align with this strategy (hereafter referred to as the " Market Strategy"). It is important to note that while Franchisee will propose potential site locations, the final decision on site selection and prioritization will rest primarily with the Franchisor. Both parties are expected to reach consensus on the Market Strategy.

original: 2. Limitation on Development Rights.
modified:
2. Expanded Permission Regarding Development Restrictions.

The Owner shall have the discretion to restrict or limit the scope and type of development within the Property, subject only to any express exceptions specified in this Agreement or any applicable laws. In the event that no such restrictions are explicitly stated herein or in law, the Owner shall possess an unrestricted right to develop the Property as they see fit, without prior approval or notice to the Purchaser.

original: 2.7.  Provided there exists no default by Developer under this Agreement or any other development, franchise or other agreement between Franchisor and Developer, Franchisor shall evaluate each site proposed for which Developer has provided all necessary evaluation information, and shall promptly after receipt of Developer’s proposal, send to Developer written notice of acceptance or non-acceptance of the sit 2.8.  If RESAC determines through its evaluation of the proposed site that the proposed site may impact sales at any company-owned El Pollo Loco® Restaurant, Franchisor has the sole and absolute right to accept or reject the proposed site, without any obligation to discuss a possible resolution with Developer. However, Franchisor may elect to discuss with Developer a possible resolution with regard to the proposed site; however, if such an agreement cannot be reached, Franchisor has the sole and absolute right to reject the proposed site. If RESAC determines through its evaluation of the proposed site that the proposed site may potentially impact sales at any existing El Pollo Loco® franchisee’s restaurant, Franchisor shall notify Developer of the existing El Pollo Loco® franchisees’ location(s) and contact information. If nevertheless Developer wishes to try to proceed with that site, Developer must obtain a written waiver from those existing El Pollo Loco® franchisees of any claims they might have against Developer and Franchisor with respect to the proposed new El Pollo Loco® Restaurant. Such waiver, if obtained, must be submitted along with the evaluation information required pursuant to this Section.
ollama_generated:
2.7. The Developer's compliance with this Agreement and any other related development, franchise, or similar agreements between the Franchisor and the Developer is a prerequisite for Franchisor's evaluation of proposed sites. Upon receipt of all necessary information from the Developer for site evaluation, the Franchisor will review each proposal promptly and communicate its decision in writing to the Developer.

2.8. If, during the evaluation process, RESAC identifies a potential threat to sales at any company-owned El Pollo Loco® Restaurant due to the proposed site, the Franchisor reserves the right to negotiate a resolution with the Developer. However, it is understood that the ultimate decision regarding the acceptance or rejection of the proposed site remains with the Franchisor. The Developer shall be informed of any existing El Pollo Loco® franchisees' locations and contact details if RESAC determines that the proposed site may potentially impact their restaurants. If the Developer still wishes to proceed with such a site, they must obtain a signed waiver from the affected franchisees, absolving them of any potential claims related to the new El Pollo Loco® Restaurant. This waiver, if obtained, must be submitted along with the required evaluation information in accordance with this Section.

original: 2.9.  No later than the Site Commitment Dates set forth in Exhibit “B ”, Developer shall submit for the Approved Site to Franchisor for its review and approval of:
ollama_generated:
2.9. The Franchisor will require Developer, at least by the Site Commitment Dates outlined in Exhibit "B", to present the proposed developments on the Approved Site for the Franchisor's scrutiny and potential disapproval:

This revision slightly shifts the responsibility from the Developer submitting for approval to the Franchisor requiring the Developer to submit. It also inverts the condition, as now it is the Franchisor who may potentially disapprove instead of approving the proposed developments.

original: 2.11.  Franchisor shall have no liability under any lease or purchase agreement for any El Pollo Loco® Restaurant location developed under this Agreement and shall not guarantee Developer’s obligations thereunder.
ollama_generated: 2.11. Developer shall assume all responsibilities and liabilities arising from any lease or purchase agreements concerning an El Pollo Loco® Restaurant location established pursuant to this Agreement, with the Franchisor providing no assurance of Developer's obligations under such contracts.

original: 2.13.  Each subsequent site to be developed pursuant to the Development Schedule shall be submitted for approval by RESAC by the date set forth in Exhibit “B”.  Similarly, each fully executed lease (executed upon prior review and approval by Franchisor) or purchase agreement (with all contingencies to Developer’s obligations waived or satisfied, except permitting contingencies) relating to each subsequent Approved Site shall: (1) be delivered to Franchisor on or before the Site Commitment Date for each respective El Pollo Loco® Restaurant as set forth in Exhibit “B”  and (2) prior to the execution of your Franchise Agreements (3) prior to the payment of your initial Franchise Fees for each site and (4) prior to the commencement of construction of the El Pollo Loco® Restaurant.
ollama_generated:
2.13. The submission of each proposed site for development, as per the Development Schedule, shall be made to Franchisor by the date specified in Exhibit "B". In return, Franchisor agrees to review and provide approval for each fully executed lease (once it has been signed) or purchase agreement (with all developer obligations' contingencies waived or fulfilled, except permitting contingencies). The following conditions apply:

(1) Lease and purchase agreements shall be delivered to Developer on or before the Site Commitment Date for each respective El Pollo Loco® Restaurant as set forth in Exhibit "B".
(2) Prior to the review and approval of your Franchise Agreements by RESAC.
(3) Prior to the payment of any initial Franchise Fees associated with each site.
(4) Construction of the El Pollo Loco® Restaurant may only commence subsequent to the aforementioned conditions being met.

original: 2.14.  RESAC site approval does not assure that a Franchise Agreement will be executed. Execution of the Franchise Agreement is contingent upon Developer completing the purchase or lease of the proposed site within sixty (60) days after approval of the site by the Franchisor or no later than the dates set forth in Exhibit “B”  as Site Committment Dates.
ollama_generated: 2.14. The approval of the RESAC site does not guarantee the signing of a Franchise Agreement. However, the execution of such an agreement is subject to the Developer providing evidence of the purchase or lease of the proposed site within sixty (60) days following the site's approval by the Franchisor. In the event that the Site Commitment Dates outlined in Exhibit "B" are not met, the Franchise Agreement may still be executed, but only upon the Developer fulfilling this requirement at a later date mutually agreed upon by both parties.

original: 5.2.  In the event of third party claims of the right to develop the Territory, it is the sole responsibility of El Pollo Loco, where the right granted herein is exclusive, to protect and maintain Developer's right to the development of the Territory. However, if it appears to El Pollo Loco, as its sole and absolute right to determine, that protection of the Territory by legal action is not advisable, whether due to the anticipation of, or the actual protracted nature of the action, the costs involved, the uncertainty of outcome, or otherwise, Franchisor has the right to terminate this Agreement, provided that it refunds to Developer the balance, if any, of the Development Fee made pursuant to Section 3, which has not been applied against the initial franchise fees for Franchise Agreement(s) to be acquired under this Agreement.
modified: 5.2. Should a third party assert a claim to develop the Territory, the Developer shall assume primary responsibility for upholding their right to do so within the scope of the exclusive grant received herein. Nonetheless, if, acting solely and absolutely at its discretion, the Franchisor deems that initiating legal action to safeguard the Territory may not be prudent, considering factors such as expected length or uncertainty of the proceedings, potential costs, or any other relevant considerations, the Franchisee has the authority to terminate this Agreement. However, in such an event, the Franchisor shall reimburse the Developer for any unapplied Development Fee remitted under Section 3, which has not been utilized towards initial franchise fees for Franchise Agreements under this contract.

original: Source: EL POLLO LOCO HOLDINGS, INC., 10-K, 3/6/2020 6.1.  Developer expressly acknowledges El Pollo Loco's exclusive right, title, and interest in an to the trade name, service mark and trademark "El Pollo Loco", and such other trade names, service marks, and trademarks which are designated as part of the El Pollo Loco® System (the " Marks "), and Developer agrees not to represent in any manner that Developer has any ownership in El Pollo Loco® Marks. This Agreement is not a Franchise Agreement. Developer may not open an El Pollo Loco® Restaurant or use the El Pollo Loco® Marks at a particular site until it executes a Franchise Agreement for that site. Developer's use of the El Pollo Loco® Marks shall be limited to those rights granted under each individual Franchise Agreement. Notwithstanding the foregoing, El Pollo Loco® may authorize Developer in writing to use the Marks in connection with advertising and marketing activities in connection with this Agreement. Developer expressly agrees that such usage is limited to those specific activities or promotional materials approved by El Pollo Loco’s marketing department in advance. Developer further agrees that its use of the Marks shall not create in its favor any right, title, or interest in or to El Pollo Loco® Marks, but that all of such use shall inure to the benefit of El Pollo Loco, and Developer has no rights to the Marks except to the degree specifically granted by the individual Franchise Agreement(s). Building designs and specifications, color schemes and combinations, sign design specifications, and interior building layouts (including equipment, equipment specification, equipment layouts, and interior color schemes and combinations) are acknowledged by Developer to comprise part of the El Pollo Loco® System. Developer shall have no right to license or franchise others to use the Marks by virtue of this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
CLause:
Source: EL POLLO LOCO HOLDINGS, INC., 10-K, 3/6/2020
6.1. The Developer acknowledges and accepts that El Pollo Loco retains exclusive ownership of the trade name, service mark, and trademark "El Pollo Loco", as well as any other trade names, service marks, and trademarks within the El Pollo Loco® System (the "Marks"). The Developer understandably agrees not to assert any ownership over these Marks. This Agreement does not constitute a Franchise Agreement.

The Developer is prohibited from operating an El Pollo Loco restaurant or using the El Pollo Loco Marks at a particular site without first executing a Franchise Agreement for that location. The Developer's right to use the El Pollo Loco Marks will be limited to those rights explicitly granted under each individual Franchise Agreement. However, El Pollo Loco may grant the Developer, in writing, permission to utilize the Marks for advertising and marketing activities associated with this Agreement. Any such usage is strictly confined to those specific activities or promotional materials approved by El Pollo Loco's marketing department in advance.

The Developer hereby acknowledges that such use of the Marks does not grant them any rights, title, or interest in the El Pollo Loco Marks, but instead benefits El Pollo Loco. The Developer possesses no rights to the Marks beyond those explicitly granted by the individual Franchise Agreement(s).

The Developer recognizes that building designs and specifications, color schemes and combinations, sign design specifications, and interior building layouts (including equipment, equipment specifications, equipment layouts, and interior color schemes and combinations) form part of the El Pollo Loco® System. Furthermore, the Developer holds no rights to license or franchise others to use the Marks based on this Agreement.

original: 6.3.  Developer acknowledges that it will receive one (1) copy of the Operations Manual on loan from Franchisor and that the Operations Manual shall at all times remain the sole property of the Franchisor.
ollama_generated: 6.3. It is understood that Franchisor will lend one (1) copy of the Operations Manual to Developer for use during the term of this agreement. The Developer shall return this copy upon termination or at Franchisor's request, and the Operations Manual shall always remain the exclusive property of the Franchisor. In case of loss or damage, Developer shall be responsible for the cost of replacement.

original: 7.4.  Developer shall defend immediately upon tender of defense, at its own cost, the Franchisor, its subsidiaries, parent and affiliates, shareholders, directors, officers, employees and agents (collectively for this section only known as “ Franchisor ”), from and against any and all claims, lawsuits, complaints, cross complaints, arbitrations, demands, allegations, costs embraced by indemnity, loss, costs, expenses (including attorneys’ fees), liens and damages (collectively for this section only known as “ Losses ”), however caused, and reimburse Franchisor for all costs and expenses (including attorneys’ fees) incurred by the Franchisor in defense of any Losses, resulting directly or indirectly from or pertaining to or arising out of, or alleged to arise out of, or in connection with Developer’s activities under the Development Agreement, including any labor, any employee related claims whatsoever, including, without limitation any claims made by an employee of Developer resulting from the employee’s training in a Franchisor operated facility or restaurant, and including Developer’s failure for Source: EL POLLO LOCO HOLDINGS, INC., 10-K, 3/6/2020 any reason to fully inform any third party of Developer’s lack of authority to bind the Franchisor for any purpose.
ollama_generated: 7.4. The Franchisee shall assume responsibility and initiate prompt action, at their own expense, to protect the Franchisor, its subsidiaries, parent companies, affiliates, shareholders, directors, officers, employees, and agents (collectively referred to herein as "Franchisor"), from any and all claims, lawsuits, complaints, cross-complaints, arbitrations, demands, allegations, costs incurred under indemnity, losses, costs, expenses (including legal fees), liens, and damages (collectively referred to herein as "Losses") arising from or related to the Franchisee's activities under this Agreement. This includes but is not limited to labor disputes, employee-related claims, and any claims made by an employee of the Franchisee due to their training in a Franchisor-operated facility or restaurant. Moreover, the Franchisee agrees to compensate the Franchisor for all costs and expenses (including legal fees) incurred during the defense of such Losses, and acknowledges that they will be held responsible for any failure to disclose fully to any third party their lack of authority to bind the Franchisor for any purpose.

original: 9. Acknowledgment of Selected Terms and Provisions of the Franchise Agreement.
modified:
9. Recognition of Disavowal of Imposed Terms and Provisions in the Franchise Agreement.

Explanation: The original clause expresses an acknowledgement, while the rewritten version uses a term that implies a disavowal or rejection, thereby weakening the obligation to accept the terms and provisions specified in the franchise agreement.

original: 11. Events of Default.

a. Failure by Developer to meet the requirements of the Development Schedule within the time periods specified therein, including failure by Developer to meet the Site Commitment Date or Opening Date for each site for an El Pollo Loco® Restaurant in a timely manner as set forth in Exhibit “B”  and Section 2 above.
ollama_generated: a. In the event that the Developer fails to adhere to the stipulated timeframes within the Development Schedule, as outlined in Exhibit "B" and Section 2 above, for meeting Site Commitment Dates or Opening Dates for each El Pollo Loco® Restaurant site, such delays will not be considered material breaches of this agreement, provided that the Developer makes good faith efforts to mitigate the delay and completes construction within a reasonable timeframe as determined by the parties in consultation.

original: 11.2.  The following events shall constitute a default by Developer, which shall result in El Pollo Loco's right to declare the termination of this Agreement, if such default is not cured within thirty (30) days after written notice by Franchisor to Developer:
ollama_generated:
11.2. Should Franchisor issue a written notification to Developer regarding any of the following occurrences, failure by Developer to remedy such situations within thirty (30) days will be considered a breach of this Agreement, permitting El Pollo Loco to terminate this contract:

Events constituting a breach by Developer include but are not limited to:
- Failure to meet agreed-upon quality standards or operational requirements, as defined in Section 4.1 of this agreement.
- Delays in the execution of any obligations set forth in this Agreement beyond the permitted grace period, unless such delay is mutually agreed upon by both parties in writing.
- Any material violation of the terms and conditions outlined within this Agreement or relevant laws and regulations, provided that a single infraction does not necessitate immediate termination.
- Failure to maintain and operate the franchise in accordance with El Pollo Loco's established policies and procedures.
- Any action that may harm the reputation or goodwill associated with El Pollo Loco or its brand.

original: a. Developer's default in the performance or observance of any covenant, term, or condition contained in this Agreement not otherwise specified in Section 11.1 above.
ollama_generated: b. Obligations or requirements set forth in this Agreement that are not explicitly exempted under Section 11.1 above, shall be the responsibility of the Developer unless such failure to perform or observe is due to circumstances beyond their reasonable control.

original: 11.3.  If Franchisor is entitled to terminate this Agreement in accordance with Sections 11.1 or 11.2 above, Franchisor shall have the right to undertake the following action instead of terminating this Agreement:
ollama_generated: 11.3. In the event that the Franchisee breaches any provision of this Agreement, as outlined in Sections 11.1 or 11.2 above, the Franchisor shall not be obligated to terminate this Agreement immediately. Rather, the Franchisor shall have the discretion to enforce compliance with the terms of the Agreement and, if such breach persists, may choose to terminate this Agreement at a later time.

original: 12. Effect of Termination.
ollama_generated:
12. Consequences of Continuance Post-Termination.

Upon termination of this Agreement, the Obligated Party shall continue to fulfill their obligations with respect to any outstanding matters and ongoing projects for a period of [insert timeframe], but shall not be required or obliged to undertake any new tasks or initiate any new projects. Any costs, fees, or expenses incurred during this transitional period shall be the responsibility of the Terminating Party. The Obligated Party's compliance with this clause shall not constitute a waiver of their termination rights under any other provisions of this Agreement.

original: 13.1.  El Pollo Loco's consent to or approval of any act or conduct of Developer requiring such consent or approval shall not be deemed to waive or render unnecessary El Pollo Loco's consent to or approval of any subsequent act or conduct hereunder.
ollama_generated: 13.1. Any approval or consent granted by El Pollo Loco for actions undertaken by Developer does not serve as a waiver or elimination of the need for El Pollo Loco's approval or consent for subsequent acts or conduct under this agreement. In other words, prior approvals do not supersede the necessity of future approvals or consents.

original: 14.2.  Under no circumstances shall Franchisor be liable for any act, omission, contract, debt, or any other obligation of Developer. Developer shall indemnify and save Franchisor harmless against any such claim and the cost of defending it arising directly or indirectly from or as a result of, or in connection with, Developer's actions pursuant to this Agreement.
modified: 14.2. The Franchisee shall bear all responsibilities for any actions, inactions, contracts, debts, or obligations undertaken during the course of their activities under this Agreement. The Franchisor will be indemnified and held harmless by the Franchisee against any claims that may arise as a consequence of these actions, including the expenses incurred to defend such claims. In essence, the Franchisee assumes liability for any obligations or liabilities stemming from their conduct under this Agreement, while the Franchisor is protected from such repercussions.

original: b. If negotiation efforts do not succeed, the parties shall engage in mandatory but non-binding mediation by a mediator jointly chosen by the parties or if the parties cannot agree upon a mediator, appointed by, and in accordance with the procedures of, JAMS or, if JAMS is no longer in existence, an organization of similar quality c. A mediation meeting will be held at a place and at a time mutually agreeable to the parties and the mediator. The Mediator will determine and control the format and procedural aspects of the mediation meeting which will be designed to ensure that both the mediator and the parties have an opportunity to present and hear an oral presentation of each party’s views regarding the matter in controversy. The parties act in good faith to resolve the controversy in mediation.
ollama_generated:
a. In case negotiation attempts fail, it is compulsory for the parties to participate in non-binding arbitration. The appointed arbitral authority will be either mutually decided upon by the parties or, if agreement cannot be reached, selected by JAMS or an organization of comparable caliber, should JAMS no longer exist.
   b. An arbitration hearing shall occur at a location and time acceptable to both parties and the arbitrator. The arbitrator will manage and regulate the format and procedural elements of the hearing, with the goal of allowing all parties to express their perspectives and respond to one another regarding the disputed issue. It is incumbent upon the parties to approach this arbitration process in good faith, aiming for resolution.

original: d. The mediation will be held as soon as practicable after the negotiation meeting is held. The mediator will be free to meet and communicate separately with each party either before, during or after the mediation meeting within 60 days of demand by either party.
ollama_generated: d. The mediation may occur at a time convenient for both parties, following the negotiation meeting, but not later than 60 days from the demand by either party. The mediator shall have the discretion to interact privately with either party before, during, or after the mediation session as deemed necessary for the resolution process.

original: 17.1.  Each section, part, term and/or provision of this Agreement shall be considered severable, and if, for any reason, any section, part, term and/or provision herein is determined to be invalid, contrary to, or in conflict with, any existing or future law or regulation, by any court or agency having valid jurisdiction, then such shall be deemed not to be a part of this Agreement, but such shall not impair the operation of, or affect the remaining portions, sections, parts, terms and/or provisions of this Agreement, which will continue to be given full force and effect and bind the parties hereto.
ollama_generated: 17.1. Every section, part, term, or provision within this Agreement is considered independent and autonomous. In the event that any such element is deemed invalid, inconsistent with current or future law or regulation by a court or competent agency, it shall be excluded from this Agreement without affecting the validity or enforceability of the remaining sections, parts, terms, or provisions. The unaffected portions will continue to carry their full weight and bind the parties involved.

original: EMAIL:
ollama_generated:
EMAIL (ALTERNATIVE):

In the event that written communication is required, the Sender shall have the option to send electronic messages via email, provided that such electronic messages are sent in compliance with the following:

1. The email must be clearly marked as "Legal Notice" or "Official Communication."
2. The email must include the Sender's full name, position, and contact information.
3. The Sender acknowledges that email is not always secure and accepts the risk of unintended disclosure.
4. The Sender will ensure that the email content is accurate, clear, and does not contain any misleading or false statements.
5. If the email requires a response, the Sender shall allow a reasonable timeframe for the recipient to respond, taking into account normal business hours and any other factors that may affect the recipient's ability to respond promptly.
6. In the event that the recipient does not respond within the specified timeframe, the Sender will make reasonable efforts to seek clarification or resolution. If such efforts are unsuccessful, the Sender may choose to resort to alternative means of communication.
7. The Sender acknowledges and agrees that any responses to this email shall be deemed as received only upon confirmation of receipt by the Sender. Any actions taken based on the content of this email shall be at the sole risk of the recipient.
8. The recipient is responsible for ensuring that their email system is adequately maintained, monitored, and secure to prevent unauthorized access or alteration of emails. If any emails are lost, damaged, or altered due to technical issues beyond the control of the Sender, the Sender shall not be held liable.
9. The Sender reserves the right to request confirmation of receipt for important communications, and the recipient agrees to respond promptly to such requests.
10. This email is intended solely for the addressee named above and may contain confidential and/or privileged information. Any use, disclosure, copying, or distribution beyond the addressee is strictly prohibited and may be unlawful. If you have received this email in error, please notify the Sender immediately and delete the message from your system without saving a copy. Unauthorized use, disclosure, or distribution of this email may result in legal action.

This clause outlines the conditions under which email communication may be used for official purposes, emphasizing the risks associated with email communication and clarifying the responsibilities of both the sender and recipient regarding the secure transmission, accuracy, and timeliness of such communications.
